messages.message:
Does anyone have a custom classifier that stopped working recently? When attempting to run with this classifier (https://www.instabase.com/apps/classifier/laura/bootcamp/fs/Instabase%20Drive/classifiers/custom_paystub.ibclassifier), which clearly exists, Google Cloud reports for the following error:
```{/instabase-api-server-apps/py/instabase/handler/views/apps/shared/flow_util.py:1045} ERROR - Error compiling the flow binary. root_id=601483cb-c486-4c35-a955-fc5a83b4fdd7 and error=Cannot open a non-existent file in r mode. Path: laura/bootcamp/fs/Instabase Drive/laura/bootcamp/fs/Instabase Drive/classifiers/custom_paystub.ibclassifier```
It looks like classifier or something is appending an extra {user}/{repo}/fs/{drive} to the path
This could be a problem with my classifier port - maybe it's the UI sending the wrong thing?
That’s what I was wondering, it is possible that the UI was not sending the repo and user at first but now is?
if it is that, is there any workaround we could do for the training tomorrow?
you could use “apply UDF” and create a UDF that classifies. not sure how much work that would be… @Aaron Vontell any guesses?
@laura I can try to fix it locally and you could run that part locally.. would that work?
How much work do you think that would be?
I don’t think we can use local host or dogfood for the training
So we’d have to weigh the possibility of a push to instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
This actually looks like a problem with running flows, not with classifier itself
I'll try looking into this more tonight, but if this is a problem where I think it is I don't see why it's not affecting all metaflow runs
And my flow changes were in two releases ago I think
